title: Amazon Product Research Analyst
job_overview:
Job Description: Amazon Product Research Analyst

Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented and creative Amazon Product Research Analyst to join our team. This role involves researching products from vendor catalogs, analyzing competitors, calculating Amazon fees, and determining profitability for potential listings. The ideal candidate will also propose creative product combinations and variations to maximize sales potential on Amazon.

Key Responsibilities

Product Research: Analyze vendor catalogs to identify products suitable for listing on Amazon.

Competitor Analysis: Research top competitors for selected products, documenting their pricing, features, and customer reviews in a structured spreadsheet.

Fee and Profitability Analysis: Calculate Amazon fees (e.g., FBA fees, referral fees) and assess potential profit margins to determine if listing a product is financially viable.

Creative Listing Development: Propose innovative product combinations and variations based on Amazon data and personal creativity (e.g., creating listings for paper cups with lids, cups without lids, standalone lids, or multi-size cup combos).

Data Management: Maintain accurate and organized spreadsheets to track product details, competitor data, fees, and profitability metrics.

Market Trend Awareness: Stay informed about Amazon marketplace trends and customer preferences to recommend high-potential products and strategies.

Qualifications

Experience:

Experience in product research, or data analysis (Amazon marketplace experience preferred).

Familiarity with Amazon Seller Central and FBA processes is a plus.

Skills:

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven recommendations.

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets for data organization and calculations.

Creative thinking to develop unique product combinations and listing strategies.

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

Nice-to-Haves:

Experience with Amazon product research tools (e.g., Helium 10, Keepa).

Knowledge of Amazonâ€™s pricing and fee structures.

Personal Attributes

Creative and innovative, with a knack for identifying market opportunities.

Comfortable working independently and collaborating with a small team.

Reliable and punctual.
